name: Octopus and Shrimp Pasta
author: John Hoppe
summary: I have always liked octopus but always had a problem finding a good recipe. Here is a combination of some of the ones I like. Serve over the pasta of your choice.
ingredients: 2 pounds octopus, head and tentacles separated
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Cut octopus tentacles away from the piece that holds them together; cut into smaller pieces
Combine octopus pieces and shrimp in a skillet over medium-high heat; cover and cook in their juices until octopus is almost tender, about 25 minutes
Transfer octopus and shrimp to a bowl, reserving juices in the skillet
Stir onion, salt, bay leaves, and black pepper into the skillet; increase heat and cook until juices are reduced and onion takes on the color of the juices, 3 to 5 minutes
Stir in tomatoes and sriracha sauce; cook for 5 minutes
Return octopus and shrimp to the skillet
Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until flavors combine and sauce thickens, about 30 minutes
